item.title: Quarry, Ballyneety
item.description: Sound + Single-Channel Video, Loop, 21mins ‘Quarry, Ballyneety’ is a quiet voice + signal-processing performance responding to a limestone quarry in County Limerick, and the ecology now flourishing in its man-made habitat (sand martins, jackdaws, buzzards, hares among them). The calls of a peregrine falcon interrupt the performance. The piece was captured using a stereo pair of high-sensitivity mics, Zoom recorder and a DSLR camera. The piece was exhibited as part of ‘The Limerick Show’ at Ormston House, 29th Nov 2024 to 1st Feb 2025.

item.title: Ireland (for desktop wallpapers, voice and signal processing)
item.description: Single channel video with sound, 8.5mins This piece playfully interrogates the idyllic picture of ‘Ireland’ that the country exports to the wider world. Though the landscape is often sold as a quaint and unspoiled haven, in reality, human over-extraction and ecological destruction dominates the landscape, and no stone is left unturned in the pursuit of capitalist gain. ‘Ireland’ leans into this uncanny deception: a slideshow of imagery pulled from a Google search of “Ireland” is overlayed with a turbulent voice and electronics sound performance – juxtaposing pixellated misrepresentations of the landscape with a volatile, harsh sonic accompaniment.

item.title: Grasslands
item.description: Sound performance with single channel video projection, 30mins Grasslands’ was a 30 minute solo improvised sound performance for the opening of STARLING arts space, Limerick. Keating performed with voice, signal processing, and field recording, incorporating found and AI-generated text relating to Irish agricultural grasslands. A durational video projection of a sunset over County Limerick grasslands underpins the performance.

item.title: Stare at the Landscape Until Time Becomes Liquid
item.description: Single channel video loop with sound (63mins), website-based text, and QR code installation ‘Stare at the Landscape’ is a multimedia meditation on landscape – our relationship with it, the memory embodied in it, and the futurity potential in it. The work features a 63 minute single channel video of Limerick landscapes shot over a 15-month period, sound, and a web-based stream-of-consciousness text piece which viewers can access through their own devices using a QR code.

item.title: MEMORY_LANE_(dump)
item.description: Single channel HD video with sound, 36.5mins A 36 minute audiovisual thesis artwork completed for practice-based MA Art and Technology in UL. Large volumes of digital archival materials pertaining to Limerick are combined with footage of the Limerick landscape, to explore the land as a haunted, digitally mediated palimpsest. The piece probes questions of memory, place, hauntology, nostalgia, historical narratives, temporality and the digital archive. The piece was exhibited in ‘The Limerick Show’ (2022) in Ormston House.

item.title: Home Video (1993-2003)
item.description: CRT Video Installation with sound, variable duration ‘Home Video 1993-2003’ is an audiovisual installation piece in which the artist’s family’s home VHS tapes are digitally processed and juxtaposed by a generative algorithm in realtime, and displayed on his family’s old disused CRT TV. Different times layer and blur into one another – chronology is thrown into disarray, and time becomes out of joint. The sentimental nostalgia of the home video viewing experience is abstracted, the familiarity of it is altered, in order to allow an eerie agency of time to present itself.

item.title: FARM
item.description: Single channel HD video with sound, 9.5mins ‘FARM’ is a short video art experiment in bringing the past, present and future of an Irish farming landscape into question. It was filmed on the artist’s family’s farm in County Limerick. An early video work as part of MA Art and Technology in UL. Featured music is ‘Oraison’ by Olivier Messiaen. Watch here
